notesStmt.note: An index to the Small Book of Commandments is found on folios 105b-107b, listing 331 sections; The Small Book of Commandments is an abridgement of Moses of Coucy's Large Book of Commandments (Sefer mitsvot gadol); the sections are visibly numbered 5(ה) - 333 (של"ג) on folios 2a-104a; the last section begins with the words שלא לבא על אשת אביו.; additional section דיני מקוה ("The Rules of the Ritual Bath"), which also belongs to the Small Book of Commandments, starts on folio 105a after the colophon followed by a blank page; written in a smaller script, Perez of Corbeil's Glosses are found scattered throughout the Small Book of Commandments; Hebrew marginal notes including corrections in different hands on folios 3a, 6b-7a, 10a, 14b-15b, 17a, 19b-20a, 22a, 27a, 32a, 50b-51a, 53a, 54b, 55b, 56b-58a, 60a-b, 66a, 67b, 68b-69a, 70b-71a, 83a, 86a, 92b, 95a, 105b-106b, 109b, etc.; interlinear notes on folio 15b; Latin marginal note at the top of folio 39a

msContents.summary: This illuminated Ashkenazi manuscript was possibly produced in the Duchy of Brabant around 1346. The main text is The Gates of Exile, also known as the Small Book of Commandments, of Isaac ben Joseph of Corbeil, a thirteenth-century compendium of halakhah in which the legal material is enlivened by homilies, parables and stories. The glosses that Isaac's pupil, Perez ben Elijah, supplied for the work are recorded in the manuscript in a smaller script. It is followed by The Gates of Düren of Isaac ben Meir of Düren, dealing with the dietary laws (kashrut). A certain Berachiah ben Samuel copied the texts for Eliezer ben Yequtiel.

msItem.title: Sefer Mitsvot Qatan, and other works
msItem.author: Isaac ben Joseph, of Corbeil
Perez ben Elijah, of Corbeil, -approximately 1295
Dueren, Isaac ben Meir, active 13th century

respStmt.persName: Crawford, James Ludovic Lindsay, Earl of, 1847-1913

msItem.colophon: Colophon to Sefer Mitsvot Qatan on f.104a

msItem.title: Sefer Mitsvot Qatan, or Small Books of Commandments, by Isaac ben Joseph of Corbeil [ff.1a-107b]. This text has altenative titles, 'Ammude ha-golah, Pillars of the Exile, and עמודי הגולה. The named scribe is Berachiah ben Samuel, and the patron was Eliezer ben Yequtiel. Also, Haggahot al Sefer Mitsvot Qatan, or Glosses on the Small Books of Commandments, by Perez of Corbeil.
אני ברכיה הסופר בר שמואל/ כתבתי הספר הזה לר׳אליעזר / בר יקותיאל : Colophon
The Rules of the Ritual Bath. An additional section which belongs to the Small Book of Commandments.
Index to the Small Book of Commandments [ff.105b-107b].
Template for a (remarriage?) contract (partially in Aramaic).
Templates for a Levirate marriage contract and a contract for remarrying the divorced.
Sha'arei Dura, or The Gates of Düren, by Isaac ben Meir of Düren [ff.109a-119a].

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation, Arabic numerals, top outer corner of side a of each folio

layoutDesc.layout: Three columns with 40 written lines (except for folios 42b, 45b, 117b-119a); ink ruling on folios 71-80; lead pencil ruling in the rest of the codex; prickings visible on folios 71-79

decoDesc.decoNote: The decoration was executed by three different hands: Hand A: Six full-page frontispieces at the main divisions (folios 1a, 7b, 32a, 52b, 87b, 109a); all initial words that are rubricated and surrounded by violet pen-drawn filigree panels; pen-drawn scrolls issuing from the filigree; panels are prolongated in the margins, ending in anthropomorphic hybrids and marginal illustrations of animal fables; Hand B: The painted frontispiece on folio 77b; the filigree ornaments and marginal figures on folios 71a-79a and 112b; Hand C: a later (German Ashkenazi) hand has added some colors to a few extant marginal pen-drawings and the text illustrations on folio 105a

1aPainted frontispiece. Gilded initial-words לידע on a blue painted panel with white branches and white and yellow flowers growing from a gilded vase. A monkey sits on the left and a hare on the right. The panel is divided by four gilded pillars; from each pillar grows a tree. Above the pillar are gothic style arches; the middle arch has a green leaf. The text of the page is enframed. The frame has painted pink, blue, green and gilded compartments. Out of the frame grow a branch with leaves (left centre, left corner and bottom centre), acorns (right corner) and a branch with leaves on which sits a bird (right centre). In the left margin stands a male figure. On the bottom of the frame sit a dragon spitting fire and a dog with one paw lifted. The text space has three initial-words decorated with penwork.
1bOne initial-word in green with blue penwork. The penwork shows three figures: two animal heads (top and right bottom) and a male bearded head (bottom left).
2aFour initial-words in red decorate with violet penwork. Four dragon heads in violet penwork and one female figure with a headdress.
2bA dog hunting a hare, executed in violet penwork.
3aTop and bottom: large fish in violet penwork and several leaf-motifs. Three initial-words in red with a panel of violet penwork.
3bHunter shooting an arrow at a squirrel, in violet penwork.
4aDog hunting a hare, in violet penwork.
4bA dragon in violet penwork, his tail ending in a branch with a leaf.
5aGrotesque figures in violet penwork: two male faces, one wearing a medieval hat. A face en profil and a dressed animal. Initial-word in red with violet penwork decoration.
5bGrotesque figures in violet penwork: head of woman wearing a headdress, four human faces, bird, two dragon heads. Six initial-words in red with violet penwork decoration.
6aThree grotesque dragon heads in violet penwork. Four initial-words in red with violet penwork decoration.

6bSeveral animal figures in violet penwork: fox and dragon (bottom), a hare (right), human face (top). Eight initial-words in red with violet penwork decoration. Four of the penwork initial-word panels are decorated with a human face en profil.
7aGrotesques in violet penwork: woman with a headdress (bottom), two dragon heads (top). One initial-word in red with violet penwork decoration.

7bPainted frontispiece. Gilded initial-words לאבד ע''ז on a painted panel consisting of four compartments: two blue squares with white lozenges, two pink squares with white squares. The panel has a gilded frame with gilded studs on top. The text of the page is enframed by a frame consisting of several compartments with alternating colours: gilded, pink and blue. Painted decorations on the frame: dragon (top left), floral motifs (centre left), dog (bottom left), bird on branch (bottom centre), hare (bottom right), bird on branch (centre of right margin), dragon (top). The text has several initial-words in red with violet penwork decoration; one human face.

8aThree human faces in violet penwork: woman with headdress (bottom), two men with medieval hats (top). On the internal margin a hare on a hill with foliage. Four initial-words in red with violet penwork decoration.

8bSeveral grotesques in violet penwork: male head with foliage (bottom left), dressed animal (bottom right), head of woman with headdress (top right), dragon head (top left), two human faces en profil (centre). Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.

9aSeveral grotesques in violet penwork: head of woman with headdress (bottom left), bald male head (bottom right), dragon head (top right), fish (top left). Four red initial-word with decorated panels of violet penwork, two human faces en profil.
9bGrotesques in violet penwork: two lionesque figures (bottom), two dragon heads (top). Seven red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.

10aFigures and grotesques in violet penwork: male head with headdress and male bearded head (bottom), long fish (centre), one dragon head, one head of a hare and bird with flowers (top). Nine red initial-words decorated with violet penwork.
10bGrotesques in violet penwork: bishop and animal head (bottom), long fish (centre right), goat and male bearded head (top). Eight red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
11aDog hunting a hare in violet penwork.
11bBearded man and dragon (bottom); head of man wearing medieval hat in violet penwork. One red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
12aAnimal head (bottom); bird on leaf (right); dragon head (top) in violet penwork. Seven red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
12bTwo birds sitting on foliage in violet penwork.
13aDragon head (left); foliage (bottom) in violet penwork. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
13bThree dragon heads; a fish; foliage in violet penwork. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration, one human face en profil.
14aDog looking at hare in violet penwork with words.
14bGrotesque figure in violet penwork: birdlike creature with feathers and very long neck, wearing a medieval hat. Its tail ends in a grotesque face.
15aFish, dragon head (bottom) and leaf (top) in violet penwork. Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
15bLion in violet penwork.
16aLion in violet penwork.
16bAnimal grotesque, human face and foliage in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
17aDragon in violet penwork; his tail ends in a branch with leaves.
17bHuman head with medieval hat (bottom); dragon head (top) in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
18aDragon in violet penwork; his tail ends in a branch with leaves.
18bThree dragon heads and a human face in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
19aThree dragon heads in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
19bSmall dragon in violet penwork; his tail ends in a branch with leaves.
20aTwo-headed dragon in violet penwork.
20bPeacock in violet penwork, very roughly coloured in with green paint.
21aThree dragon heads and a human face in violet penwork. Seven red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
21bTwo dragon heads, human winged face and fish with foliage in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
22aDragon head with foliage; male face with medieval hat; bearded male face in violet penwork. Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
22bDragon in violet penwork.
23aTwo birds sitting on foliage in violet penwork.
23bRunning dog in violet penwork ; the hare he hunts is depicted on the opposite page.
24aRunning hare in violet penwork; the dog he is hunted by is depicted on the opposite page.
24bThree-headed dragon in violet penwork with foliage.
25bA winged human face; a dragon head; a human face en profil in violet penwork. Three red initial-letters with violet penwork decoration.
26aHare hunt in violet penwork: hunter (far left) blows a horn, dog (centre) runs after the hare (right), tree.
26bDragon head; foliage; head of a man wearing a medieval hat in violet penwork. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
27aTwo two-headed dragons with foliage in violet penwork; the tails with their extra heads are intertwined.

27bSeveral grotesques in violet penwork, clockwise from top left: woman's head wearing headdress; male head; bird sitting on plant; dragon head. Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
28aTwo grotesques in violet penwork: a male figure shooting an arrow (bottom); head of a woman wearing a headdress (top). Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
28bTwo dragon heads (bottom and top right); pointing male figure (bottom left) in violet penwork. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
29aReading female figure with headdress (bottom), possibly male figure with tallit; dragon head (top) in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
29bTwo dragon heads (bottom); centaur piercing a dragon head with a lance (top), human face en profil in violet penwork. Eight red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
30aMale head wearing chaperon (bottom); bearded male head with long ears (top) in violet penwork. Four red-initial words with violet penwork decorations; several en profile faces.
30bSeveral grotesques in violet penwork: male head, mouse head and dog head (bottom); two dragon heads and an animal head (top). Eleven red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.

31aSeveral grotesques in violet penwork: two dragon heads (bottom and top left); long-beaked bird head (top right); three en profile male heads (right). Nine red initial-words decorated with violet penwork; several en profile faces.
31bFour dragon heads with foliage in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.

32aPainted frontispiece. Gilded initial-word לעשות on a painted panel consisting of four compartments: two pink squares; one with a dragon and one with small squares; two blue squares; one with a dragon and one with small squares. The panel has a gilded frame with gilded buds growing from its top. The painted frame at the left and bottom of the text consists of blue, pink and gilded compartments. Several painted figures are depicted. Left: a dragon, a bird, foliage. Bottom: a dog running, a man beating a drum. Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
33aThree violet penwork figures: bird on a branch (left); a small dragon biting its own body (bottom) and a bird with a nest and two baby birds (right).
33bThree dragon heads, one human face of violet penwork. Red initial-word decorated with violet penwork.
34aMale head, dragon and male head wearing a chaperon in violet penwork. Red initial-word decorated with violet penwork.
34bDragon head; head of a woman wearing a headdress in violet penwork. Red initial-word decorated with violet penwork.
35aFigure playing a bagpipe (bottom); fish (top) of violet penwork. Red initial-word decorated with violet penwork; human face en profil.
35bSeveral grotesques in violet penwork. Bottom: dog head; male winged head; bird on a leaf. Top and right: three dragon heads. Five red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
36aFour dragon heads; a hog head; a dog head in violet penwork. Six red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
36bTwo grotesque animal heads, one dragon head, one male head. Six red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several faces en profil.

37aFour human faces in violet penwork: two ladies wearing a headdress (bottom); two men, one wearing a medieval hat (top). Small animal head on the internal margin. Seven red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
37bTwo violet penwork figures: bird sitting on a branch (top); man killing a bird with a sling (bottom).
38aBottom: woman with cap, armed figure with helmet; top: woman, bearded face in violet penwork. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
38bFemale centaur with headdress playing a citer, in violet penwork.
39aFemale centaur with headdress in violet penwork.
39bGriffin with a male head wears a medieval hat, in violet penwork.
40aMale figure with two cups (bottom); male figure with headdress and food (?) in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.

40bSeveral figures in violet penwork: centaur beating a drum (bottom); bird with foliage (right and left); two figures fighting each other, the right figure has a falchion as weapon and the left figure a rapier (top).
41aA male figure with a cap and two birds with foliage, in violet penwork.
41bTwo birds with foliage; two-headed dragon; male head with medieval hat in violet penwork.
42aDragon; dressed animal; male head hearing a chaperon; foliage in violet penwork.
42bTwo-headed dragon with human faces and foliage in violet penwork.
43aOwl sitting in a tree; dog hunting a hare in violet penwork.
43bOwl sitting in a tree; dog digging out a hole; griffin with a male face wearing a medieval hat in violet penwork.
44aThree dragon heads, two wearing headdresses in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
44bTwo birds with foliage in violet penwork.
45aTwo dragons connected by a human head in violet penwork.
45bTwo dragon heads; one animal head in violet penwork. Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
46aThree dragon heads, two male figures (one bald and one bearded) in violet penwork. Four red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.
46bHead of a woman with headdress; bird in nest; animal head in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
47aTwo-headed dragon (bottom) and small dragon (top) in violet penwork.
47bFour dragon heads in violet penwork. One red initial-word with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.
48aAnimal with female face wearing a headdress (left); dragon (right); animal with foliage (top) in violet penwork.
48bDragon with three heads in violet penwork; one head bites in the body.
49aThree dragon heads; one dog head in red penwork. Two black initial-words with red penwork decoration.
49bLong-beaked bird wearing a chaperon; dragon with a human face wearing a medieval hat in violet penwork. The figures are roughly coloured in with green paint.
50aDragon in violet penwork, its body coloured green.
50bTwo-headed dragon with foliage in violet penwork.
51aTwo dog heads with a bone in their mouths; a hare eating foliage in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
51bTwo two-headed dragons with foliage, in violet penwork; the tails with their extra heads are intertwined.
52aA dog hunting a hare in violet penwork.

52bPainted frontispiece. Gilded initial-word לשחוט on a painted panel consisting of four compartments: two pink and two blue, all compartments with small white squares. It has a gilded frame. The painted frame surrounding the text consists of gilded, blue and pink compartments. Several painted figures are depicted: twice a dog with foliage (bottom and top); twice a hare (bottom and top) and a bird (right). Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
53bTwo dragon heads; long-beaked bird eating a fish; a dog head in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
54aThree dragon heads, one wearing a female headdress, in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
54bDressed bird figure; goat head in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.
55aTwo dragon heads in red penwork; human head in violet penwork. One red initial-word with violet penwork decoration; one black initial-word with red penwork decoration; human face en profil.
55bTwo-headed dragon with foliage and a bird in violet penwork. The bird has a little red colour in its head.
56aDragon; its tail ending in a bird head wearing a cap; foliage with a bird in violet penwork.
56bHead of woman with headdress and a bit of clothing; dragon head; head of woman with headdress of violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
57aHare and bird with foliage in violet penwork.
57bThree-headed dragon in violet penwork.
58aLion with a dog in his mouth, in violet penwork.
58bTwo human heads; dragon head; dog head in violet penwork. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
59aHuman figure playing a flute; dragon head in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.
59bWolf with a sheep in his mouth, in violet penwork. The wolf and sheep are slightly coloured in with black and grey.
60aGrotesque human figure blowing a trumpet; a hare head eating a leaf; several male heads en profile in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
60bDog catching a hare in violet penwork.
61aHorse with a tree in violet penwork.
61bA fox blowing a trumpet in violet penwork; he is coloured orange.
62aHorse head; two animal heads in violet penwork. Red initial-word decorated with violet penwork; human face en profil.
62bHead of a woman wearing a headdress; female figure with headdress blowing a trumpet in violet penwork. Red initial-word decorated with violet penwork.
63aTwo female heads with headdresses; two grotesque male bearded faces in violet penwork. Four red initial-words decorated with violet penwork.
63bLong-beaked bird head; dragon head eating an animal (hare?); dragon head; dragon head eating a fish in violet penwork. Two red initial-words decorated with violet penwork; human face en profil.
64aDog licking his genitals in violet penwork.
64bLion catching a sheep in violet penwork. The lion has a red tongue.
65aDog catching a chicken in violet penwork. Parts of the chicken are coloured red.
66aTwo-headed dragon in violet penwork.
66bAnimal playing a flute in violet penwork.
67aWinged male head; dragon head; woman with headdress and an animal body in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
67bThree bearded male heads, one of them a grotesque; a bird; two women heads wearing a headdress in violet penwork. Five red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.
68aTwo hares escaping to their lair in violet penwork.
68bTwo-headed animal with two human heads in violet penwork.
69aA monkey with a coconut in violet penwork.
69bTwo-headed dragon in violet penwork; one of the heads bites its own body. One of the heads is a male grotesque face.
70aTwo-headed dragon in violet penwork; one head has the face of a hare.
70bMale figure in violet penwork; female head wearing a headdress with an animal body in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
71aRed initial-word with red, blue and green penwork decoration: foliage, a running dog's body with a hand where his head should be. A dragon head, a human face and foliage.
72aTwo-headed dragon with two fighting heads in blue penwork. Human faces in red and blue penwork. Three initial-words with coloured backgrounds.
72bAnimal with short sword and buckler in red penwork; two goats sticking out their tongues in red penwork. Green initial-word on red panel decorated with blue, green and red penwork.
73aSix initial-words in different colours decorated with violet, green, red and yellow penwork. Bird biting a snake; dog sticking out his tongue; hooded animal; grotesque animal head.

73bTwo initial-words in blue with a yellow and a green panel. Decorated with red, green, yellow and blue penwork. Yellow snake with dragon head; small dragon with fish head; hand holding a bird; winged male head.
74aFive initial-words in different colours decorated with green, red, yellow and purple penwork. Bird with another animal head; dragon biting its own leg; foliage; dragon eating a fish; hog.
74bGreen initial-word in red panel decorated with red penwork. A bird head with two dragon bodies; dragon head eating an animal; man's face wearing a medieval hat.
75aTwo initial-words in different colours decorated with violet penwork. Animal body with a tree growing from its neck; dog head and human face with medieval hat in the tree.

77bPainted frontispiece. Gilded initial-words לתת נבילה on a pink painted panel with green ranks and small red flowers. On the panel stand two painted birds. The text has two green painted bars on its sides and a blue bar at the bottom. The two green bars turn into fruit trees with gilded fruits at the top of the page. The blue bar is wrapped round with red and green painted branches. The following painted figures can be seen in the margins: a hare spying on a dog (left); a bird eating a plant and a monkey (right). In the text are four initial-words in the colours red, green, black, blue and violet decorated with green, blue and red penwork.
78aMermaid with animal ears; male figure blowing a trumpet, small medallion with a bird in red penwork. Green initial-word with red penwork decoration.
78bTwo fish; goat's head; sheep's head in violet penwork. Green initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
79aA vase; a fish; four animal heads wearing caps in violet penwork. Blue initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
81aFish; a bird; grotesque head in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.
81bKangaroo-like animal; its tail ending in an animal head with foliage; a human face on its belly; it has a winged human face made in violet penwork.
82aTwo male heads wearing medieval hats; two animal heads in violet penwork. Five red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human faces en profil.
82bHuman head and two animal heads in violet penwork. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.

83aArmed figure with falchion; bearded male head; dragon head; male figure with outstretched arm in violet penwork. Eight red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human faces en profil.
83bDragon with three heads in violet penwork.
84aMale head with headdress and four legs; standing monkey in violet penwork.
84bSix red initial-words with violet penwork decoration. With three grotesque human heads and two dragon heads.
85aTen red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human faces en profil.
85bFour-headed dragon; bird with foliage in violet penwork.
86aDog getting ready to attack a hare; bird sitting in a tree in violet penwork.
86bThree animal heads in violet penwork. Four red initial-words with violet penwork decoration.
87aFemale figure with a dress and headdress holding a cookie (?); woman's head with headdress in violet ink. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.

87bPainted frontispiece. Gilded initial-word לעשות on a panel consisting of four painted rectangles. Two are blue with small squares; two are pink with dragons. The painted frame surrounding the text consists of blue, gilded and pink compartments. The following painted figures are depicted: dog hunting a hare (bottom); hunter blowing a horn; bird (right); running dog (top). Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
88aFour human faces (one female with headdress) in violet penwork. Two red initial-words decorated with violet penwork.
88bDragon head; male figure playing a citer; woman head with headdress in violet penwork. Two red initial-words decorated with violet penwork.

89aBird head; two dressed male figures; bird with foliage; fully armed man with a falchion, buckler and hauberk in violet penwork. Two red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human faces en profil.
89bTwo-headed beast with one female head, and two birds with foliage in violet penwork.
90aTwo female heads; animal head; bearded male head; bird; crowned animal head in violet penwork. Three red initial words and letters with violet penwork decoration.
90bHare blowing a flute; bird sitting in a tree in violet penwork.
91aThree-headed dragon and bird with foliage in violet penwork.
91bAnimal head; female head; bird; male head with chaperon; fish in violet penwork. Seven initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human faces en profil.
92aMale head; female figure blowing a flute in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.
92bGrotesque animal (partly the body of a snake, partly the body of a dog) and a bird with foliage in violet penwork.
93aDragon with foliage in violet penwork.
93bDog biting a hare; an owl sitting in a tree in violet penwork.
94aTwo-headed dragon and a bird with foliage in violet penwork.
94bGrotesque male dressed figure with a tree in violet penwork.
95aDog biting a hare and a bird with foliage in violet penwork.
95bDragon and bird with foliage in violet penwork.
96aTwo-headed creature (snake neck, winged, human heads) with foliage in violet penwork.
96bDog and a hare sitting opposite each other; three trees, a bird in each tree in violet penwork.
97aSmall three-headed dragon.
97bAnimal head biting a chicken; animal head holding a scroll in his mouth in violet penwork. Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human heads en profil.
98aSmall two-headed dragon in violet penwork; one of the heads bites its own body.
98bTwo birds, one attacking the other; bird in a tree in violet penwork.
99aGrotesque human figure; bird with foliage in violet penwork.
99bGrotesque figure with a female and male head and an animal body; a bird and foliage in violet penwork.
100aHare blowing a flute in violet penwork.
100bWoman holding a cookie (?), looking at a male head at the top of the page, in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.

101aTwo birds; male head; female head; head of a long-beaked bird; hog head wearing a headdress in violet penwork. Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human faces en profil.
101bMale head; bird; female head in violet penwork. Three red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; human head en profil.
102aDog with foliage in violet penwork.
102bMale head; female head; animal head; foliage in violet penwork. Fourteen red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human heads en profil.
103aDog with open mouth and a bird's head growing from its behind; a stork puts its beak in the dog's open mouth (in violet penwork).
103bDog with a rabbit in its mouth, in violet penwork.
104aThree animal heads holding an animal in their mouth; in violet penwork. Sixteen red initial-words with violet penwork decorations. Six words in black with red penwork decoration.

105aText illustration: a woman sits in a tub, another woman gets immersed in 'life-water', as is expounded in the text. Illustration to laws on taking the mikvah (ritual bath). It is made of black penwork and is coloured in. Red initial-words with violet penwork decoration; several human heads en profil.
107bRed initial-words with violet penwork decoration; human face en profil.

109aPainted frontispiece. Gilded initial-word בשר on a painted panel that consists of a painted pink and a painted blue compartment, both with smaller panels in white paint. It has a gilded frame. The painted frame surrounding the text consists of blue, gilded and pink compartments. The following painted figures are depicted: two dragons, a bird and foliage. In the text a red initial-letter with violet penwork decoration.
109bBird with foliage in violet penwork. In the text a red initial-letter with violet penwork decoration.
110aTwo-headed dragon with foliage in violet penwork. In the text a red initial-letter with violet penwork decoration.
110bTwo-headed dragon in violet penwork. One of the heads wears a medieval hat.
111aTwo fish with foliage; a bird with foliage; dragon head in violet penwork. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
111bTwo dragon heads in violet penwork; one head wears a medieval hat. Red initial-word with violet penwork decoration.
112aHare; two birds with foliage in violet penwork.
112bTwo dragon heads in red penwork. Two black initial-letters with red penwork decoration.
113aHare; bird with foliage; dog with foliage in violet penwork.
113bTwo-headed dragon with foliage; bird with foliage in violet penwork.
114aFish with foliage; small dragon with foliage in violet penwork. Red initial-letter with violet penwork decoration.
114bTwo-headed dragon with foliage in violet penwork.
115aHare with foliage in violet penwork. Two dragon heads in red penwork. Black initial-letter with red penwork decoration.
115bLion with foliage in violet penwork.
116aTwo-headed dragon with foliage; bird with foliage in violet penwork.
116bTwo dragon heads in red penwork. Black initial-letter with red penwork decoration.
117aTwo-headed dragon in violet penwork.
117bBird in tree; monkey in violet penwork; coloured cooking pot, referring to the laws of purity concerning pots used for cooking described in the text.
118aBird in tree; man shooting an arrow in violet penwork.
118bHare and two birds with foliage in violet penwork.
119aDragon with foliage in violet penwork.

binding.p: Brown leather binding, with gold-tooled floral border design on front and back boards; gold-tooled flowers and ספר [...] on spine; coloured fore, top and bottom edges to produced a marbled effect; sewn on six raised cords

origin.p: Place (Brabant) and date of production of the manuscript could be the same as the ones indicated in the divorce document on folio 42b; if so, the manuscript would have been produced in the city of טרטא possibly near the rivers Dijle (?) and Meuse (?) [על נהר דילא ... על נהר מזא], on January 27, 13465 (25 Shevat 5106). The other placename mentioned, פטרא, is that of the place where the intended divorcee Judith presently lives. The decoration, which shows typical elements of mid-fourteenth-century gothic illuminations of Western Ashkenaz (Rhineland, Meuse area or Brabant) book-painting, confirms this dating. The flower motives of the frontispiece on fol. 1r, for example, as well as the monkey, the profusion of marginal grotesques and hybrids invite to relate this manuscript to the Codex Levy 19 of Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg, dated 1309 from Brussels; c. 1346

history.provenance: Acquired by Enriqueta Rylands in 1901 from James Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford of Haigh Hall, and later bequeathed to the John Rylands Library
